value.title: AZ-104: Implement and manage storage in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to manage storage in Azure and prepare for Exam AZ-104: Microsoft Azure Administrator.

topItems.title: Configure blob storage
topItems.excerpt: You will learn how to configure blob storage including tiers and object replication.

topItems.title: Configure storage security
topItems.excerpt: You will learn how to configure common storage security features like storage access signatures.

topItems.title: Configure Azure files and Azure File Sync
topItems.excerpt: You will learn how to configure Azure file and file sync.

topItems.title: Configure storage with tools
topItems.excerpt: You will learn how to configure storage with tools like Storage Explorer and AZCopy.

value.title: AZ-400: Define and implement continuous integration
value.excerpt: Create automated pipelines that continuously build, test, and deploy your applications and prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Create a build pipeline with Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Set up a continuous integration (CI) pipeline that automates the process of building your application.

topItems.title: Run quality tests in your build pipeline by using Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Find out about automated testing that proves your code to be maintainable, understandable, and functioning without repetitive manual testing.

topItems.title: Manage build dependencies with Azure Artifacts
topItems.excerpt: In this module, the Space Game web team guides you through creating a build pipeline that produces a package that can be used by multiple applications.

topItems.title: Host your own build agent in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Work with guidance from the Space Game web team to set up your build agent running on-premises or on an Azure virtual machine running in the cloud.

value.title: Build applications with Azure DevOps
value.excerpt: In this learning path, find out how to collaborate with others to continuously build, test, and verify your applications using Azure Pipelines and GitHub.

topItems.title: Create a build pipeline with Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Set up a continuous integration (CI) pipeline that automates the process of building your application.

topItems.title: Implement a code workflow in your build pipeline by using Git and GitHub
topItems.excerpt: Learn along with the Space Game web team the benefits of collaboration through Visual Studio Code and GitHub.

topItems.title: Run quality tests in your build pipeline by using Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Find out about automated testing that proves your code to be maintainable, understandable, and functioning without repetitive manual testing.

topItems.title: Manage build dependencies with Azure Artifacts
topItems.excerpt: In this module, the Space Game web team guides you through creating a build pipeline that produces a package that can be used by multiple applications.

value.title: Build great solutions with the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework
value.excerpt: Learn how to design and build secure, scalable, high-performing solutions in Azure using the pillars of the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework.

topItems.title: Introduction to the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework
topItems.excerpt: Learn how using key principles throughout your cloud architecture can help you design and build a solid architectural foundation that you can continuously improve.

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Cost optimization
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use the cost optimization pillar of the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework to design a cloud-based architecture that is efficient, eliminates waste, and gives you full visibility into where your money is spent on cloud resources.

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Operational excellence
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to design an Azure architecture that uses modern practices and gives you full visibility into what's happening in your environment.

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Performance efficiency
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to adjust your capacity based on workload and how to optimize network performance, storage, and database performance.

value.title: Connect your services together
value.excerpt: Use Azure to create website front-ends, back-end services, and triggered functions that compute-on-demand and can also communicate with each other.

topItems.title: Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services
topItems.excerpt: Learn how Azure's storage queues, event hubs, event grid, and service bus can improve your communication between devices.

topItems.title: Implement message-based communication workflows with Azure Service Bus
topItems.excerpt: Discover how to write code in .NET applications using Azure Service Bus for communications that can handle high demand, low bandwidth, and hardware failures.

topItems.title: Communicate between applications with Azure Queue storage
topItems.excerpt: Find out to use Azure Queue storage to handle high demand and improve resilience in your distributed applications.

topItems.title: Enable reliable messaging for Big Data applications using Azure Event Hubs
topItems.excerpt: Learn to use Azure Event Hubs to reliably process high-volume data streams to enable you to code applications to send and receive messages through the hub.

value.title: Control Azure spending and manage bills with Azure Cost Management + Billing
value.excerpt: Learn how to monitor and control your Azure spending and optimize the use of Azure resources.

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Cost optimization
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use the cost optimization pillar of the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework to design a cloud-based architecture that is efficient, eliminates waste, and gives you full visibility into where your money is spent on cloud resources.

topItems.title: Plan and manage your Azure costs
topItems.excerpt: Migration to the cloud presents new ways to think about your IT expenses. This module teaches you about the factors that influence cost and tools you can use to help estimate and manage your cloud spend.

topItems.title: Analyze costs and create budgets with Azure Cost Management
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use cost analysis to understand how your costs accrue each month.

topItems.title: Save money with Azure Reserved Instances
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use plan for, buy, and manage Azure reservations to save money.

value.title: Deploy and manage resources in Azure by using ARM templates
value.excerpt: Learn how ARM templates enable you to manage both basic and complex infrastructure deployments on Azure.

topItems.title: Deploy consistent infrastructure in Azure by using Azure Resource Manager (ARM) templates
topItems.excerpt: Write Azure Resource Manager templates by using Visual Studio Code to deploy your infrastructure to Azure consistently and reliably.

topItems.title: Deploy to multiple Azure environments by using ARM templates
topItems.excerpt: Manage multiple Azure environment deployments of your Azure Resource Manager templates by using functions, variables, tags, and parameter files.

topItems.title: Preview Azure deployment changes by using what-if
topItems.excerpt: Apply the what-if command to see the impact of a deployment before it's applied.

topItems.title: Validate your deployments by using what-if and the ARM template test toolkit
topItems.excerpt: Leverage the ARM template test toolkit and apply it on your Azure Resource Manager templates to ensure the templates follow good practices before deployment. Apply the what-if command to see the impact of a deployment before it's applied.

value.title: Deploy and manage resources in Azure by using Bicep
value.excerpt: Learn how Bicep enables you to manage both basic and complex infrastructure deployments on Azure.

topItems.title: Introduction to infrastructure as code using Bicep
topItems.excerpt: Describe the benefits of using infrastructure as code, Azure Resource Manager, and Bicep to quickly and confidently scale your cloud deployments.

topItems.title: Build your first Bicep template
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create Bicep templates and create reusable infrastructure as code.

topItems.title: Build reusable Bicep templates by using parameters
topItems.excerpt: Control and apply parameters to a Bicep template while protecting sensitive inputs.

topItems.title: Build flexible Bicep templates by using conditions and loops
topItems.excerpt: Build advanced Bicep templates by using conditions to conditionally deploy resources and using loops to deploy multiple instances of resources.

value.title: Introduction to Azure IoT
value.excerpt: Follow this learning path for a broad and compelling introduction to the fundamentals of building IoT solutions with Azure IoT.

topItems.title: Enabling digital transformation
topItems.excerpt: Digital transformation is a wave of business innovation fueled by the explosion of technology—data, applications, and devices are everywhere. The cloud, artificial intelligence (AI), and the internet of things (IoT) give organizations new ways to make sense of information and generate insights to transform their business. Realizing the benefits of digital transformation requires business leaders to look beyond technology to reimagine existing business models and embrace a different way of bringing together people, data, and processes to create value for customers.

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure IoT strategy and solutions
topItems.excerpt: This module provides an overview of Azure IoT, and describes Microsoft tools, services, and infrastructure. This knowledge can help bring IoT to life for your organization and customers.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure IoT Hub
topItems.excerpt: University of Oxford

topItems.title: Learn how to manage IoT devices as an IT admin
topItems.excerpt: This module is an introduction to the Internet of Things for IT admins.

value.title: Monitor the usage, performance, and availability of resources with Azure Monitor
value.excerpt: Learn how to monitor the usage, performance, and availability of resources using Azure Monitor.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure Monitor
topItems.excerpt: Learn what Azure Monitor is and where you would use it.

topItems.title: Design a holistic monitoring strategy on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Use monitoring services on Azure to bring operational excellence to your applications and infrastructure.

topItems.title: Monitor the health of your Azure virtual machine by using Azure Metrics Explorer and metric alerts
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to monitor the health of your Azure VMs by using Azure Metrics Explorer and metric alerts.

topItems.title: Capture and view page load times in your Azure web app with Application Insights
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you'll configure Application Insights and use it to study page load data for an Azure web app.

value.title: Process natural language with Azure Cognitive Language Services
value.excerpt: Process natural language with Azure Cognitive Language Services

topItems.title: Add basic conversational intelligence to your apps by using Language Understanding Intelligent Service (LUIS)
topItems.excerpt: Learn to identify valuable information in conversations with LUIS for interpreting user goals (intents) and distill valuable information from sentences (entities).

topItems.title: Manage your Language Understanding Intelligent Service (LUIS) Apps
topItems.excerpt: Learn to manage LUIS apps through versioning, key management, handling data, and improving predictions.

topItems.title: Use containers for your Language Understanding Intelligent Service (LUIS) Apps
topItems.excerpt: The Language Understanding (LUIS) container loads your trained or published Language Understanding model. As a LUIS app, the docker container provides access to the query predictions from the container's API endpoints

topItems.title: Discover sentiment in text with the Text Analytics API
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use the Text Analytics API and Azure Functions to discover what your customers are really saying in their feedback about your products or brands.

value.title: Run high-performance computing (HPC) applications on Azure
value.excerpt: Azure HPC is a purpose-built cloud capability for HPC & AI workload, using leading-edge processors and HPC-class InfiniBand interconnect, to deliver the best application performance, scalability, and value. Azure HPC enables users to unlock innovation, productivity, and business agility, through a highly available range of HPC & AI technologies that can be dynamically allocated as your business and technical needs change. This learning path is a series of modules that help you get started on Azure HPC - you can choose topics you are most interested in or progress through each of them one by one.

topItems.title: Introduction to high-performance computing (HPC) on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Discover the services available on Azure for your high-performance computing workloads.

topItems.title: Create an Azure Batch account by using the Azure portal
topItems.excerpt: Azure Batch is an Azure service that enables you to run large-scale parallel and high-performance computing (HPC) applications efficiently in the cloud. There's no need to manage or configure infrastructure. Just schedule the job, allocate the resources you need, and let Batch take care of the rest.

topItems.title: Run parallel tasks in Azure Batch with the Azure CLI
topItems.excerpt: Find out about the Azure Batch capabilities designed to help you efficiently run large-scale parallel and high-performance computing applications in the cloud.

topItems.title: Create an app to run parallel compute jobs in Azure Batch
topItems.excerpt: Learn to use the Azure Batch platform to write a .NET Core console app that performs parallel, large-scale, high-performance video transcoding.

value.title: Understand data science for machine learning
value.excerpt: Machine learning is enables data scientists make predictions about objects, people, and the future. This learning path is a high-level introduction to machine learning for people with little or no knowledge of computer science or statistics.

topItems.title: Introduction to machine learning
topItems.excerpt: A high-level overview of machine learning for people with little or no knowledge of computer science and statistics. You’ll be introduced to some essential concepts, explore data, and interactively go through the machine learning life-cycle - using Python to train, save, and use a machine learning model like we would in the real world.

topItems.title: Build classical machine learning models with supervised learning
topItems.excerpt: Supervised learning is a form of machine learning where an algorithm learns from examples of data. We progressively paint a picture of how supervised learning automatically generates a model that can make predictions about the real world. We also touch on how these models are tested, and difficulties that can arise when training them.

topItems.title: Introduction to data for machine learning
topItems.excerpt: The power of machine learning models comes from the data that is used to train them. Through content and exercises, we explore how to understand your data, how to encode it so that the computer can interpret it properly, how to clean it of errors, and tips that will help you create models that perform well.

topItems.title: Train and understand regression models in machine learning
topItems.excerpt: Regression is arguably the most widely used machine learning technique, commonly underlying scientific discoveries, business planning, and stock market analytics. This learning material takes a dive into some common regression analyses, both simple and more complex, and provides some insight on how to assess model performance.

value.title: Work with Data Warehouses using Azure Synapse Analytics
value.excerpt: Work with Data Warehouses using Azure Synapse Analytics

topItems.title: Design a Modern Data Warehouse using Azure Synapse Analytics
topItems.excerpt: Learn how Azure Synapse Analytics enables you to build Data Warehouses using modern architecture patterns.

topItems.title: Design a multidimensional schema to optimize analytical workloads
topItems.excerpt: Design a multidimensional schema to optimize analytical workloads

topItems.title: Use data loading best practices in Azure Synapse Analytics
topItems.excerpt: Use data loading best practices in Azure Synapse Analytics

topItems.title: Optimize data warehouse query performance in Azure Synapse Analytics
topItems.excerpt: Optimize data warehouse query performance in Azure Synapse Analytics

value.title: Work with relational data in Azure
value.excerpt: This learning path introduces you to Azure-supported SQL-based enterprise data solutions enabling you to store and retrieve your app's data in the cloud.

topItems.title: Provision an Azure SQL database to store application data
topItems.excerpt: Find out what makes Azure SQL Database a good choice for your relational database, how to create the database from the portal and connect with Azure Cloud Shell.

topItems.title: Migrate your relational data stored in SQL Server to Azure SQL Database
topItems.excerpt: Plan and implement the migration of relational data from SQL Server to Azure SQL Database. Select the appropriate migration strategy for your database, and then use Data Migration Assistant to do the assessment and the migration.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure Database for PostgreSQL
topItems.excerpt: This module is a no-code introduction to PostgreSQL on Azure, including an explanation of particular problems that using Azure Database for PostgreSQL can solve. At a high level, we show how the components fit together and identify situations where you should use Azure Database for PostgreSQL.

topItems.title: Scale multiple Azure SQL Databases with SQL elastic pools
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create SQL elastic pools and how to use them to manage performance and cost for a collection of SQL databases.

value.title: Create a Linux virtual machine in Azure
value.excerpt: This module guides you through options for virtual machines in Azure, creating and connecting a Linux virtual machine, and configuring your network settings.

value.title: Design your migration to Azure
value.excerpt: Minimize the time and resources required to migrate your on-premises environment to Azure. Assess your current systems with Azure Migrate, and migrate them with Azure Migrate and Azure Database Migration Service.

value.title: Manage users and groups in Azure Active Directory
value.excerpt: Manage users and groups in Azure Active Directory

value.title: Getting started with Azure Static Web Apps | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Anthony Chu joins Scott Hanselman to show how to build, debug, and deploy a full-stack serverless application in minutes with Azure Static Web Apps.  0:00 – Introduction 0:55 – Overview 3:03 – Demo - basic stuff 12:48 – Demo - a little more advanced 18:41 – Wrap-up  🔗 What is Azure Static Web Apps?

value.title: Azure Portal “How To” Series
value.excerpt: Welcome to our weekly series that highlights specific aspects of the Azure portal so you can be more efficient and productive while deploying your cloud workloads from the portal.

topItems.title: How to organize subscriptions with Management Groups
topItems.excerpt: In this episode of the Azure Portal “How-to” series, learn the benefits of organizing your subscriptions into a hierarchal structure of management groups. We’ll show you how to create management groups to group and govern subscription activity, policies, security, role assignments and cost.    - Try
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/4v9_6duE25s" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: How to capture a VM image and use it from the image gallery
topItems.excerpt: In this episode of the Azure Portal “How-to” series, learn how to create an image from your virtual machine. We’ll show how you can then use that image to create more virtual machines and replicate the image across Microsoft Azure regions.    - Try out these features in the Azure portal: https://portal.azure.com

topItems.title: Quick command tips for copying, pasting, and more
topItems.excerpt: In this episode of the Azure Portal “How-to” series, learn how to quickly and easily copy the current view's title, print the current view, or go full screen increasing focus on the current view.   - Try out these features in the Azure portal: https://portal.azure.com  - Keep connected on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AzurePortal

topItems.title: How to build a graph and use links in Azure Workbooks
topItems.excerpt: In this episode of the Azure Portal “How-to” series, learn how to create a hive cluster in Microsoft Azure workbooks for high-density views and how to use links in workbooks to show other workbooks or to reference Azure portal blades.    - Try out these features in the Azure portal: https://portal.azure.com

value.title: Accelerate cloud adoption with the Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure
value.excerpt: Do you need a clear path forward for your cloud journey? This learning path includes best practice guidance to help you create a cloud strategy, define a cloud adoption plan, prepare your cloud environment with proper governance, and implement cloud operations in alignment with your organizational needs.  Cloud architects and IT professionals will learn and engage with the proven best practices, tools, and documentation in the Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure to build the technical knowledge needed to help your organization successfully adopt the cloud and meet business goals.

topItems.title: Getting started with the Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure
topItems.excerpt: CAF getting started. Use the Cloud Adoption Framework getting started guides to unblock your organization’s cloud adoption efforts

topItems.title: Prepare for successful cloud adoption with a well-defined strategy
topItems.excerpt: Success in cloud adoption is predicated by a clear strategy that helps the team understand executive direction and regularly measure progress. This module will help capture the cloud adoption strategy needed to drive your success.

topItems.title: CAF Plan: Prepare for cloud adoption with a data-driven plan.
topItems.excerpt: Prepare for cloud adoption with a data driven, cloud adoption plan from CAF. For new innovations, learn from others who have used the target platforms. For migrations, understand how to evaluate your assets and plan the efforts required to move them to the cloud.

topItems.title: Choose the best Azure landing zone to support your cloud operations requirements
topItems.excerpt: Azure landing zones help accelerate configuration of your environment to meet your operational requirements.
